bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to [Laura Armistead Carter] Stitt, November 16, 1948

div1.p: Kean extends sympathy to [Laura Armistead Carter] Stitt on behalf of the Board of Managers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association on the occasion of the death of her husband.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to [Laura Armistead Carter] Stitt, November 16, 1948

1625 R Street, N. W.
Washington 9, D.C.
My dear Mrs. Stitt:
div1.p:
At the annual meeting of the Board of Managers of
the Walter Reed Memorial Association on November 15, 1948, the
members of the Board were very greatly distressed to learn of the
death of Rear Admiral Stitt who had, for many years, been one of
its outstanding members.

On behalf of the members of the Board, may I
extend to you and yours our deepest and most heartfelt sympathy and
express the hope that an All-wise Providence will give you comfort
and peace in your bereavement.
